hero.title: About
hero.subtitle: Welcome to 'Where to Go in Lisbon'!

content.intro: I am Tania Barros, a Lusophone and the creator of this site, born out of my passion for Lisbon and my desire to share its treasures with you.

section1.title: From France to Portugal: A Return to Roots
section1.text1: Originally from Portugal, I grew up in France after my family moved there when I was just one year old. I lived my first experiences: my first words, my studies, my first professional adventures. After several years in Picardy and Normandy, I felt the need to return to my native country. At the age of 27, I made one of the best decisions of my life: returning to live in Portugal.
section1.text2: Here, I immediately felt at home. The warm welcome, the friendliness, the cultural richness, the gastronomy, the mild climate... Everything that makes the magic of Portugal gave me the desire to share it with others.

section2.title: A Double Hat: Communication and Tourism
section2.text1: My professional career first led me to communication and events, where I held responsible positions for companies like Bouygues Telecom and Apple. In parallel, I cultivated my passion for events by collaborating with bars, clubs, restaurants, and production agencies.
section2.text2: Then, by a fortunate coincidence, I became a tour guide seven years ago. This was a revelation: combining my passion for Lisbon, meeting people, and organizing unique experiences became an obvious choice. Specializing in Street Art, I surrounded myself with an incredible network of guides, restaurateurs, artists, and tourism professionals, allowing me to offer customized experiences.

section3.title: 'Where to Go in Lisbon': Your Personalized Guide
section3.text1: Thus was born 'Where to Go in Lisbon': an evolving site, fed by my discoveries and encounters, where I share the best addresses and experiences to explore the city differently. Today, I work with:
list: Fifty boat crews for nautical experiences,
Many drivers, restaurateurs, artists, and instructors,
And an infinite number of experiences tailored to each traveler.
section3.text2: Whether you are in a couple, family, with friends, or on business, I accompany you in your discovery of Lisbon with authentic recommendations and customized services.

section4.title: More Than Just a Guide, a Human Experience
section4.text: By choosing 'Where to Go in Lisbon', you benefit from personalized advice, a selection of trusted partners, and above all, a human and passionate service.

restaurants.title: Best Restaurants in Lisbon 2025
restaurants.intro: Discover our selection of the best restaurants in Lisbon, carefully curated by our team of local guides. From traditional Portuguese cuisine to Michelin-starred fine dining, including hidden gems in Alfama and Chiado, find the perfect restaurant for your evening in Lisbon.

traditional.title: Traditional Portuguese Restaurants
traditional.content: Lisbon is full of tascas and traditional restaurants where you can taste the famous bacalhau (codfish), grilled sardines, and cozido Ã  portuguesa. Our recommendations guide you to authentic addresses where Lisbonites themselves gather to enjoy their grandmothers' recipes.

view.title: Restaurants with Tagus River Views
view.content: For an unforgettable experience, choose a restaurant with views of the Tagus or Lisbon's rooftops. From BelÃ©m terraces to Bairro Alto rooftops, discover the most beautiful panoramas of the Portuguese capital while enjoying refined dishes.

budget.title: Where to Eat Cheap in Lisbon
budget.content: Eating well in Lisbon doesn't have to break the bank. We've selected addresses offering excellent value for money, from neighborhood canteens to lunch spots with menu do dia for less than â‚¬10.

restaurants.faqTitle: Frequently Asked Questions About Lisbon Restaurants

best.question: What is the best restaurant in Lisbon?
best.answer: The best restaurant depends on your tastes! For traditional Portuguese cuisine, we recommend Alfama restaurants. For modern gastronomy, Chiado and PrÃ­ncipe Real restaurants offer exceptional experiences. Check our selection to find the address that matches your desires.

cheap.question: Where to eat cheap in Lisbon?
cheap.answer: To eat cheaply in Lisbon, look for restaurants offering 'menu do dia' (daily menu) between â‚¬8 and â‚¬12. Mouraria and Intendente neighborhoods offer excellent budget options. Traditional tascas also serve hearty dishes at low prices.

neighborhood.question: Which neighborhood to choose for dining in Lisbon?
neighborhood.answer: Each neighborhood has its personality: Alfama for authenticity and fado, Chiado and Bairro Alto for trendy vibes, BelÃ©m for Tagus views, and Santos/Cais do SodrÃ© for trendy concepts. PrÃ­ncipe Real attracts foodies with its creative restaurants.

reservation.question: Should I book in advance at Lisbon restaurants?
reservation.answer: We strongly recommend booking, especially on weekends and for popular restaurants. Many good addresses are small and fill up quickly. We can help you book at our partner restaurants.

hotels.title: Best Hotels in Lisbon 2025 - Complete Guide
hotels.intro: Find the ideal accommodation for your stay in Lisbon with our selection of tested and approved hotels. From charming boutique hotels to 5-star palaces, including design hostels, discover the best places to stay in the Portuguese capital.

luxury.title: Luxury Hotels in Central Lisbon
luxury.content: Lisbon has magnificent 5-star hotels, often housed in tastefully renovated historic buildings. Avenida da Liberdade, Lisbon's Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es, is home to the city's most beautiful palaces, offering impeccable service and prime locations.

boutique.title: Boutique Hotels in Alfama
boutique.content: The Alfama district, Lisbon's oldest, houses charming boutique hotels nestled in traditional houses. Wake up to the sound of fado and enjoy breathtaking views of the Tagus from these intimate addresses.

budget.title: Budget-Friendly Well-Located Hotels
budget.content: It's possible to find affordable, well-located hotels in Lisbon. The Baixa, Restauradores, and MarquÃªs de Pombal areas offer good options at reasonable prices, with easy access to the metro and main attractions.

hotels.faqTitle: Frequently Asked Questions About Lisbon Hotels

neighborhood.question: Which neighborhood to choose for staying in Lisbon?
neighborhood.answer: For a first visit, Baixa (historic center) is ideal with monuments within walking distance. Alfama offers authenticity and panoramic views. Bairro Alto suits night owls. Chiado and PrÃ­ncipe Real are perfect for shopping and restaurants. BelÃ©m is quieter, ideal for families.

budget.question: What budget should I plan for a hotel in Lisbon?
budget.answer: Prices vary by season: expect â‚¬60-100/night for a decent 3-star, â‚¬120-200 for a well-located 4-star, and â‚¬250+ for luxury. In high season (April-October), prices increase by 20-30%. Book 2-3 months ahead for best rates.

when.question: When should I book my hotel in Lisbon?
when.answer: Book as early as possible, especially for peak periods (Easter, summer, popular saints' festivals in June). 3-4 months ahead is recommended for the best choice. For special events like Web Summit, book 6 months before.

transport.question: Are central hotels well-connected?
transport.answer: Yes, central Lisbon is very well served by metro, buses, and the famous trams. Most hotels are within walking distance of main attractions. We also offer private transfers from the airport.

bars.title: Best Bars in Lisbon - Rooftops, Cocktails & Nightlife
bars.intro: Explore Lisbon's vibrant nightlife through our selection of the city's best bars. From rooftops with spectacular views to intimate cocktail bars in Bairro Alto, including traditional wine bars, discover where to have a drink in Lisbon.

rooftops.title: Rooftops with Panoramic Views
rooftops.content: Lisbon is famous for its miradouros (viewpoints) and its rooftop bars offer the same spectacular views with a cocktail in hand. From PARK bar on a converted parking lot to grand hotel terraces, enjoy sunset over the Tagus in a magical setting.

cocktails.title: Trendy Cocktail Bars
cocktails.content: Lisbon's cocktail scene has grown considerably in recent years. From hidden speakeasies to prestigious hotel bars, Lisbon mixologists compete in creativity to offer innovative cocktails blending local ingredients and modern techniques.

traditional.title: Authentic Bairro Alto Bars
traditional.content: Bairro Alto remains the heart of Lisbon nightlife. Its alleys are full of small traditional bars where locals meet for terrace drinks. The atmosphere is friendly, prices affordable, and the vibe incomparable.

bars.faqTitle: Frequently Asked Questions About Lisbon Bars

best.question: What are the best rooftop bars in Lisbon?
best.answer: Among the must-visits: PARK Bar (view of the 25 de Abril Bridge), Sky Bar (Hotel Tivoli), Rooftop Bar do Hotel Mundial (castle view), and LimÃ£o (Santos). Each offers a different atmosphere, from the most relaxed to the most chic.

neighborhood.question: Which neighborhood for nightlife in Lisbon?
neighborhood.answer: Bairro Alto is the historic party district with dozens of bars. Cais do SodrÃ© and Pink Street attract a younger, trendier crowd. LX Factory offers an alternative vibe. Santos-o-Velho appeals to thirty-somethings with its lounge bars.

hours.question: How late can you go out in Lisbon?
hours.answer: Bars generally close between 2am and 4am. Clubs stay open until 6am or later. Nightlife starts late in Lisbon - Portuguese dine around 9-10pm and rarely go out before midnight.

prices.question: What budget should I plan for a night out in Lisbon?
prices.answer: A beer costs around â‚¬2-4, a cocktail â‚¬8-12 depending on the bar. Rooftops are more expensive (â‚¬10-15 per cocktail). Bairro Alto remains the most economical. Budget â‚¬30-50 for a good night including a few drinks.

guidedTours.title: Guided Tours in Lisbon - Private & Group Tours
guidedTours.intro: Discover Lisbon like a local with our guided tours. Our passionate guides take you to discover the city's hidden treasures, from the fascinating history of Sintra to the colorful alleys of Alfama. Private tours, small group excursions, or full days: find the formula that suits you.

private.title: Personalized Private Tours
private.content: Our private tours adapt to your desires and pace. Whether you want to explore Portugal's maritime history, local gastronomy, or trace the footsteps of fado, our guides create a tailor-made experience for you. Ideal for families, couples, or groups of friends.

group.title: Small Group Tours
group.content: Join our small group guided tours (maximum 8 people) for a friendly experience at an accessible price. An opportunity to meet other travelers while benefiting from personalized attention from your guide.

dayTrips.title: Day Trips from Lisbon
dayTrips.content: The Lisbon region is full of wonders to discover in a day: the fairytale palaces of Sintra (UNESCO), the wild beaches of Cascais, the Tagus Valley vineyards, or the dolphins of SetÃºbal. We organize your perfect excursion with transport and guide included.

guidedTours.faqTitle: Frequently Asked Questions About Guided Tours

french.question: Do you offer guided tours in French?
french.answer: Yes, all our tours are available in French with passionate French-speaking guides. We also offer English and Portuguese guides on request. Our guides are all local experts who live in Lisbon.

sintra.question: How to visit Sintra from Lisbon?
sintra.answer: Sintra is 40 min from Lisbon. We offer day trips including transport, a guide, and palace entrances. You'll visit Pena Palace, the Moorish Castle, and Quinta da Regaleira depending on the chosen formula.

duration.question: How long does a guided tour last?
duration.answer: Our Lisbon tours last from 3h (specific neighborhood) to 6h (complete city). Sintra, Cascais, or SetÃºbal excursions are full 7-8h days. We also offer multi-day formulas to explore the region.

booking.question: How to book a guided tour?
booking.answer: Book directly on our website or contact us by email/WhatsApp. We recommend booking at least 2-3 days in advance, more in high season. A 30% deposit confirms your booking, the balance is paid on the day of the tour.
